Review title: A New Chapter in the 'Scary Movie' Franchise!!!
Review_body: I grew up with the Scary Movie franchise. I've always welcomed another sequel. This new film was actually really funny, but has a very different tone to it. I've seen it twice so far and it keeps getting better. Anna Faris and Regina Hall are gone, but Ashley Tisdale does a fairly decent job leading the movie. The main spoofs are Paranormal Activity, Mama, Rise of the Planet of the Apes, Black Swan, and Evil Dead. Tisdale stars as Jody Sanders, a woman married to Dan (played by Simon Rex from Scary Movie 3 & 4) Jody and Dan adopt Charlie Sheen's kids, who have been hiding in the woods with 'mama' When they move in to their new home, they notice ghostly paranormal activity. Jody teams up with her ballet partner, Kendra to find the Necronomicon and try to defeat Mama. If you love spoofs and the Scary Movie series, you'll love SCARY MOVIE 5!!!

Scary Movie V (Sometimes called Scary Movie, with the V stylized as the roman numeral for five) is the final installment of the Scary Movie series of horror movie parodies, and was released a good seven years after the fourth film. You'd think with that long a wait, the creators would at least try to improve on the humor so it wouldn't rely too much on gross out toilet and sex humor, but sadly, we are mistaken.Starting with Charlie Sheen and Lindsay Lohan trying to do a video (can't say which kind in case IMDb guidelines are against it) in a messed up parody of Paranormal Activity, the story begins with Sheen's children being found by two guys who were fleeing from cannibis growers (played by Snoop Dogg and Mac Miller), they are taken under the care of his brother, Dan Sanders, and his wife, Dina. However, by bringing them to a new home, they also bring home a terrible evil.Basically, the gross humor is back, and it's joined by another kind of humor: child abuse, as some scenes have the children being harmed in what looks like comedic situations (one scene has Aiden, the baby, get his head set on fire, with Dan using a fire extinguisher to put it out, which also launches Kathy, another of the three kids, into something that bumps her head). Also, this film has a lot of disturbing stuff for a film carrying the PG-13 rating, making me wonder how they got away with it. Stay away from this film at all costs.

Review title: "Scary Movie 5" is certainly the worst of the series so far and t's time for the franchise to rest, being buried six feet under the ground
Review_body: This is the bitter end to a series that brought the parody genre to the fore again in the early 2000s and, unfortunately, what we see is a depressing ending, and that is not a word that should be used to define a proposed film. Making you laugh. Gathering a handful of actors without criteria was definitely a bad idea and a lack of commitment to the loyal audience of the series, who valued the old cast. The embarrassment of seeing jokes being made without any effect, or the rescue of commonplaces already overused in the previous four features, is to discourage anyone who has followed the development of the first films. The frustration, among other reasons, is to see a comedy that once was so authorial become silly, with bad seats, jokes out of timing and an excess of nonsense that often does not fit the scene.After David Zucker passed the baton of direction to Malcolm D. Lee, the Scary Movie franchise reached its fifth volume, rivaling in formula and content with the production of Marlon Wayans, Paranormal Inactivity, even coinciding with the parody objects, using the typical first person footage of Paranormal Activity to start your tape. The first news that shocked fans and made us wrinkle our noses was the news that Cindy (Anna Faris) and Brenda (Regina Hall) would not return. How would they manage to make a film in the series without the two main stars? Perhaps the new part of the franchise could be saved by other characters, such as Mahalik (Anthony Anderson), CJ (Kevin Hart) or the president (Leslie Nielsen), but they also don't appear. In fact, "Scary Movie5" does not bring back any character in the franchise, absolutely none. Charlie Sheen and Simon Rex even return, but playing different characters, the first participates in the bad opening scene and the second is one of the protagonists.After a mysterious incident involving a couple, played by Charlie Sheen and Lindsay Lohan, their daughters Kathy (Gracie Whitton) and Lily (Alva Kolker) somehow - equally mysterious, but this time, because of the script - they end up in a cabin in the forest, where they are found by a pair of stereotyped drug addicts experienced by Snoop Dog and Mac Miller. After being rescued, the children are adopted by their father's brother, Dan (Simon Rex), and his wife Jody (Ashley Tisdale). After that, strange things start to happen at the family home.Let's talk more about opening this part. The scene begins with Charlie Sheen and Lindsay Lohan as a couple about to have sex and who are haunted by a ghost. The scene is ridiculous and sloppy from start to finish, with poor performances and an even worse script, full of exaggerations and appeals to make the viewer laugh forcibly, which does not work. Soon after, we have another "opening scene", in which two friends, played by rappers Snoop Dogg and Mac Miller, come across a hut in the middle of the forest and there are two children. The scene is as ridiculous as the first, with stupid dialogues and even worse performances.This fifth part of the series focuses on the story of "Mama", but obviously makes reference to several other films - regardless of the genre - during the narrative, such as "Paranormal Activity", "Evil Dead", "The Conjuring", "The Last Exorcism", "Black Swan", "Inception" and the prelude to "Planet of the Apes". Originally, the feature would be a parody of "Panic 4", just as Inceptional was a parody of the first feature in the horror franchise. However, Wes Craven's film did not achieve the expected commercial success, forcing the parody producers to change their minds. This highlights the fragility of the proposal, which depends directly on the public's prior knowledge of other works to be minimally understood.References to horror films continue, showing Jody's dramas, with repetitive jokes that compare ballet to pole dance. The freak show involving ghosts and demons continues to haunt the existence of the couple, without any condition to make their viewer laugh, making the level of the first four films worse. The tape tries to mix all the aforementioned films looking for an identity, failing to find a minimally acceptable narrative line, since all the elements that add to Jody's drama are completely dispersed from any cohesion or dramaturgical structure. Few of the moments of humor manage to overcome the simple barrier of comedy, not even amusing the public accustomed to torn humorous.Zucker's departure from directing, for him to only write and produce the film, exhibited a considerable decrease in quality, not even having what worked in the rest of Everyone in Panic. The complete absence of positive predicates makes fans more eager for this cinematographic subgenre to ask themselves if the format has any chance of returning to function as entertainment, because even the undemanding viewer this Scary Movie5 is unable to please.Incidentally, the main gags of the film are totally unnecessary for the story's progress, demonstrating the lack of creativity and resourcefulness of the writers. This incompetence can also be seen in the appealing content of some scenes, where the extreme bad taste gets to be offensive, especially in the scene involving Lily and an ice lollipop. Some moments try to emulate the silly humor style of silent films, even using stop-motion in a desperate attempt to offer something that the public has not yet seen in previous films. This is so out of context that they look like bonus scenes during the film itself. When a parody reaches the point of parodying itself - as in certain scenes that refer to the first feature of the franchise -, it is a sign that it has reached rock bottom.The seven intervening years, which took place between the launch of Scary Movie 4 and the production of Scary Movie 5, served to age the type of humor that had been done so far very badly. The audience is different and has aged together. The poorly thought-out sexual scenes are not so pleasing to an audience that in the early 2000s was excited about the bizarre American Pie, and that Scary Movie explored so well. The jokes with the monkeys, the horrible prologue that makes the parody of Paranormal Activity, the first entire act contained of absurdity etc. Takes this film to the bottom of the well. Places that could be used so well here are thrown in the trash.The prologue's metalanguage, of playing with the figures of Lindsay Lohan and Charlie Sheen, does not bring anything new, in fact, it embarrasses the lack of humor in the initial scene, which does not even try to overcome what had already been done. A big problem in this film is the fact that many jokes need to be explained, reaffirmed, many times, by the character who does it. By the way, if humor needs to be explained it is a sign that there is no genuine connection between what is said and the recipient. Already aware of the lack of creativity in the script, many insights are explained within the narrative itself, as in the scene of the newspaper anchor's wife, who needs to reaffirm that she is betraying him - this after the joke has already been made - so that we realize that the scene has a touch of humor. Kind of like making a joke and explaining right away: "Hi, I made a joke, you know?". In fact, narration is used within the film, a resource not previously used, which only highlights the need for this film to seek grace at all costs, even if it explains its own jocularities.With the departure of Anna Faris and Regina Hall, the cast became very weak. Simon Rex has never been one of the strengths of the franchise, but here it is ridiculously bad. The famous non-actors invited to participate, such as Mac Miller, Snoop Dogg and Usher only make things worse and there is more for Ashley Tisdale, the only one with a really good performance in the film. The actress is no Anna Faris, but she manages to perform quite well in the midst of so much mediocrity. Probably "Scary Movie5" will not have a continuation, not only because of the bad reception by the public, but also because it got the worst box office. If that happens, we will miss Cindy, Brenda, Mahalik, CJ and the others.As if that were not enough, added to all of this we have a montage out of rhythm and continuity that further impairs the effectiveness of humor, which no longer works by itself. "Scary Movie5" is certainly the worst of the series so far and one of the worst films ever made in recent years. The sensation of total loss of time invades the thought of those who watch the tape until the end, making the prospect worse by imagining that there may be other numbers like this. The relief almost comes after 74 minutes when the final credits go up after it wasn't possible to have a laugh. Malcolm D. Lee's film suffers from the worst thing that can happen to a comedy film: lack of comic timing. It's time for the franchise to rest, being buried six feet under the ground.

Review title: New Sequel, Same Jokes, Same Mistakes
Review_body: I went into this movie locked and loaded. I'm well aware how extremely distasteful these movies tend to be and how much steam and potential is lost within the first five to ten minutes, but I stand by my credo that the last halfway decent movie parody ever seen was "Dracula: Dead and Loving It." "A Haunted House" came close, but like "Scary Movie 5," what we get isn't a very polished script nor is it anything close to a decent comedy. What it actually is just a string of bad sketches and non-sequential scenes strung together in a lazy haphazard plot. What this movie needs is a decent writer with an understanding of story structure and character development. I'm a writer, and I could have tightened and improved this movie twice over. "Scary Movie 5" is basically an imperfect spoof of the movie "Mama" with a little "Paranormal Activity" added to it and way too much "Black Swan" and "Planet Of The Apes." The "Apes" material should have been exorcised entirely; did we not learn from our mistakes with merging science fiction and horror in "Scary Movie 3" and "Scary Movie 4?" The "Black Swan" material is almost amusing, but it takes up too much time from the main plot with Simon Rex and Ashley Tisdale as a couple trying to raise kids, which by itself has huge potential for slapstick, but is instead dragged down by the weak ghost storyline and further weakened by the incessant references to "Swan" and "Apes." As usual, Simon is great at the slapstick and physical comedy as he goes through several injuries just short of getting dismembered (which instead happens to other characters in the movie), but Ashley looks uncomfortable with the sophomoric humor and R-rated material; her range in the movie is mostly limited to facial expressions and being gratuitously under-used except where someone needs to be embarrassed. They're joined by a roster of both TV and movie stars, such as Charlie Sheen, Lindsay Lohan, Snoop Dawg, Heather Locklear, Jasmine Guy, James Van Der Beek, JP Manoux, Jerry O'Connell and Morgan Freeman as the narrator. Charlie and Lindsay's opening simulated sex tirade isn't amusing nor is it funny, but it does set the style of humor for the movie. More should have been done with Lindsay's possessed scene, which ends way too fast before breaking into the graphics reminding us this is another sequel to a string of movies that didn't need sequels. Overall, the movie isn't over-stuffed with movie references, like say "Epic Movie" or "Meet The Spartans," but it still has too many when it should have confined itself to just being a haunted house comedy. Several so-called jokes are stretched too long (Charlie and Lindsay's fake sex scene to the theme of "The Benny Hill Show"), are extremely over-used (excessive use of accelerated video), just don't work (Ashley's lesbian encounter) or just go nowhere (the pool cleaners in the neighborhood have a pool party). The best jokes belong to the kids who barely get any screen time. This movie is only going to appeal to bored teenagers with limited intelligence, stoners with too much time on their hands, alcoholics scared of going home and fans of parodies hoping beyond hope that something close to "Young Frankenstein" or "Airplane" might like lightening hit twice, but at this point, all we're getting is a little shock.

Review title: The worst Scary Movie of them all
Review_body:
Its the worst scary movie of them all

I don't mind a really dumb comedy sometimes. But it actually has to be funny. Airplane, that's a stupidly funny movie, and one of the best of all time. As is The Naked Gun Trilogy and the Hot Shots series. Director David Zucker and his team really know how to do stupid right. But not even he and his co-writer Pat Proft can save Scary Movie V.Scary Movie V is a stupefyingly dumb comedy that parodies actual good movies to boost its self esteem. I'm glad Zucker skipped out on directing this thing, but he still wrote this piece of crap, which makes me sad. In fact, the entire movie makes me sad. It makes me sad because it has all of these talented people who have really hit rock bottom, with nowhere else to go. Charlie Sheen, Lindsay Lohan, Ashley Tisdale, Mac Miller, Snoop Dogg (Oops, Snoop "Lion"), Simon Rex, possibly Heather Locklear, and Katt Williams show up to this thing, and it's the saddest movie since Amour.What is this about? Good question. I don't really know. The story is so mashed together you feel as if Zucker and Proft were mainly trying to make as many references as humanly possible. They spoof Mama (the main one), Evil Dead, Paranormal Activity, Black Swan, Inception (?), and Rise of the Planet of the Apes (?).That said, I laughed once or twice, mainly at the Black Swan scenes (excluding the one where a ballerina, who I'm pretty sure is Heather Locklear, gives birth right on stage). But what also doesn't help the movie is the timing. Because Paranormal Activity has already been parodied in A Haunted House, and much better might I add.At the end of the day, Scary Movie V is pointless, unfunny, and incredibly stupid. Gee, I wonder why Anna Faris didn't show up? Probably because this movie is even too dumb for her, and she's Anna Faris! Charlie Sheen isn't winning anymore. He's losing, and pretty roughly might I add. The same goes for everyone involved in this movie.D

There were a few funny moments in this film. Molly Shannon was great, as always. I also liked the uptight blacks in the opera audience. I also chuckled during the bit at the start with Sheen and Lohan.As in SM4, the director spoofs not just horror movies, but other movies as well (including Rise of the Planet of the Apes). Simon Rex's role in this movie was reduced to utter stupidity and inane slapstick. I felt a little sorry for him.It was a very fast-paced, visual movie. Most of the visual gags and jokes fell flat for me, perhaps because I tend to avoid horror movies. (I thought they could have had more fun with "The Divide" and "Cabin in the Woods".) Am I wrong in thinking that SM1 and SM2 were actually sort of clever and funny? The franchise seems to have devolved into bozo slapstick. I don't blame Lee per se, because Zucker's SM4 was just as bad really.Not recommended, even for die-hard fans. Suitable for 11-year-olds perhaps. I hope they add a bit of wit and good writing for SM6.

Review title: Please kill off the Scary Movie franchise now.
Review_body: SCARY MOVIE VBlimey again we have a franchise that doesn't know when to end. This movie should have never been made.This movie parodies other horror films that have recently come out. In this film we see spoofs of Evil Dead, Mama, Paranormal Activity, Cabin in the Woods, Rise of the Planet of the Apes, Black Swan and Inception.I loved Scary Movie. I thought the original movie was brilliant. But after the second one they all mingle into one big mess for me. There are far too many parodies out there these days that they have stopped being funny. I guess it is one of those 'too much of a good thing' situations. I have always enjoyed stupid humour. It started when I was a kid and watched the Naked Gun. From then on I always looked out for them. But now it seems they are pushing it too far that it has lost its comedy value. I remember going to the cinema to watch Vampires Suck the whole movie sucked!Anyway back to Scary Movie 5.The movie has a lot of famous faces in, but they are mostly just cameos. They even put the cameo stars on the front cover of the DVD it's as if they knew that no-one would watch this unless it has some decent names attached to it. The main character is played by Ashley Tisdale. I was watching this movie looking at her thinking "I know her from somewhere" But I could not remember where I had seen her. Then the nightmare came back to me "NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO". It is Sharpay from High School Musical. I tried my best to delete that film from my memory. But to be honest, she didn't do a bad job in this. She was funny in places and can imagine she could be a comedy actress if she had a decent film to be in. The cameo stars were Charlie Sheen, Lindsay Lohan, Snoop Dogg, Terry Crews, Bow Wow, Heather Locklear, Jerry O'Connell & Mike Tyson. That is one hell of a cast list but they are not really on screen long enough for you to appreciate them. In some cases if you blink, you will miss them.This film is not all bad. I was laughing out loud to a few scenes. There were some scenes that were very funny. Just not enough of them. I think the main reason I found them funny is because I have seen the movies they were mimicking.I was also very surprised to see the film was only on for 1 hour 8 minutes (not including the credits). That is very short for a movie and even though it was not a great film I still would have wanted it to go on a bit longer. It felt like they had run out of things to parody so they ended the movie.Overall the film was amusing in places, but I did find myself watching it with a straight face through a lot of the gags. Mainly because they have been done a million times over. I really hope they don't make any more now. I believe this was the final nail in the Scary Movie coffin.I will give this film 5 out of 10."I'll pay you to get me out of this movie"For more reviews, please like my Facebook page:https://www.facebook.com/pages/Ordinary-Person-Movie- Reviews/456572047728204?ref=hl

It's been 7 years since Scary Movie 4 hit theaters to a pretty impressive box office run, and Scary Movie 5 brings the series back in a big fun way. If you loved the other four films (especially part 3) you will definitely get a kick out of Scary Movie 5. This is a spoof done right, written by David Zucker, the master of slapstick humor. Sure, like any spoof movie there are tons and tons of jokes and some miss the mark. However, Scary Movie 5 succeeds by sticking to its roots and rebooting the entire series for new audiences and old fans alike.The first thing you will probably notice is the rather unfortunate and upsetting lack of Anna Farris. Farris rose to stardom almost exclusively through the Scary Movie films at first, building her comedic repertoire along the way. At the time of filming, Farris was pregnant, so Ashley Tisdale fills Anna's shoes in a surprisingly fulfilling turn. Sure, she's no Cindy Campbell, but Jody is a character you can root for and Tisdale really does prove she has good comic timing. Unfortunately, there is also no Brenda (Regina Hall) or any of the other great characters to be found in the other sequels. For this film, it actually works this circumstance to its advantage, bringing back both Charlie Sheen and Simon Rex as relatives (again) but playing completely different character than their counterparts from the third and fourth installments. Some of the side characters bring the most laughs, from Molly Shannon as Heather to Tyler Posey as a hardcore Christian chilling at a cabin in the woods (long story.) The opening scene rivals the best ones in this series, and the scene fully concludes after the credits roll so stick around for a fun moment and obvious ode to the other four movies. Lindsay Lohan and Charlie Sheen were absolutely perfect choices for the opening and I really missed them once they were gone. Also, I could watch Simon Rex do his awkward comedy schtick for hours and never get bored. Rock on, Dirt Nasty!There are some really nitpicky issues to be found within this feature, but when you are watching a spoof film you really need to switch your brain off to have any fun. There are some odd dubbing issues as far as sound goes where it looks like the actor was saying something else, which most likely was a product of the numerous reshoots this movie underwent to remain more relevant. The Inception and 50 Shades of Grey spoofs kind of fall flat on their faces and bring the movie to a bit of a halt, but they are mere bumps in the road compared to the laughs to be found in the rest of the movie. I'm anxious to see an unrated version of this on DVD to see what was cut out or what footage/spoofs were excised completely from the final product.If spoofs are your thing, there is plenty of hysterical moments to be found within Scary Movie 5, which actually takes chances and doesn't rehash the same material over and over again. This isn't your typical throwaway spoof. Though the ending could have used a bit of polishing (come to think of it, I've never been fully satisfied with an ending apart from the first), the final product is very watchable and has some decidedly off-the-wall moments. I can honestly say I loved Scary Movie 5, and if you're a fan of spoofs you will probably love it too.

Review title: Terrifying in all the worst ways.
Review_body: It is almost inconceivable to imagine how much effort a group of people would have to put into making a film as bad as Scary Movie 5. The latest instalment in the series of lazy spoofs, not including some unforgivable side projects including Date Movie and Epic Movie, this film offers virtually nothing to its audience, insulting their intelligence for an hour-and-a-half with perhaps the worst collection of blatantly uninspired and recycled gags ever put to celluloid.The film's horrendous excuse for a plot centres on a suburban wife (Ashley Tisdale) and her dimwitted husband (Simon Rex) moving into a haunted house with their possessed adopted children. From there, the film brings its staple of parodying the biggest blockbusters of the last few years, but does so without a semblance of relevance, creativity or wit. It says a lot about the film that the only half-laughs to be had come from Charlie Sheen and Lindsay Lohan sharing the opening scene- an incredibly stupid and borderline cringe-worthy, but inexplicably entertaining chuckle at their fall from grace. It's all downhill from there, though, as the rest of the film plays out as a series of unconnected set pieces seen literally hundreds of times before. Often, such an unappealing movie is still able to salvage some hope by suiting itself for a target market, but it is hard to see any audience group, from 15 year-olds to stoners, defending this abomination.One would have to drink Lindsay under the table, smoke copious amounts of bud with Snoop Dogg and/or Lion and snort pure tiger blood with Charlie to even come close to drawing any semblance of enjoyment from this disaster. An imminent sweep of this year's Razzies doesn't seem like ironic punishment enough for one of the worst films ever made.*There's nothing I love more than a bit of feedback, good or bad. The stupidity of movie goers never ceases to amaze me. The fact that this drivel made almost 4 times it's overall budget of 20 million is testament to just how many people are prepared to sit through garbage that tries in vain to pass itself off as comedy.
I caught this last offering on TV one night, so thank God I've never spent a penny on seeing any of these at a cinema, but after 5 movies & 13 years later, I don't think I've ever cracked a smile at any part of this franchise that I've managed to see. The obvious and often infantile humour just seems to be getting worse with each subsequent travesty and yet as long as nonsense like this still manages to rake in a profit, we can almost guarantee a never ending run of sequels. We know they'll never run out of movies to do parodies of, right?
In this installment, we're can see renderings of recent Planet of the Apes, Paranormal Activity. Mama, Cabin in the Woods, Evil Dead and I think there's also a segment to Fifty Shades of Grey. Why they threw that in there is anyone's guess, but then again, why they felt this needed to be made at all is actually more of a mystery.
If you've seen any part of the previous 4 movies then you'll just get more lame and unfunny sight gags, toilet humour, sexual double entendre and hackneyed slapstick, so you may as well throw any and all expectations of getting a laugh, (even a cheap one), out the window
Personally I've never found parody comedies to be funny as it doesn't require any talent when ALL of your source material is somebody else's work. For me, these movies would have been funnier had they only used elements of pop culture, instead of relying on celebrity cameos or a character constantly being confused and eye-rolling in nearly every scene. 
Hopefully the negative reaction to #5 will mean that there won't be a #6 unless they decide to reboot the series, (rebooting seems to be the rage these days) but knowing the way the movie world tends to work, there's enough idiotic fans of this so-called humour to keep it going, regardless if it makes a profit or not, so there's something we can all look forward to.

2013 has had a very serious lack of comedy. What we have been sold in the comedy genre has been embarrassingly bad, low-brow humor or indie dramatic comedies where the film's emotional core always over-shadows any potential laughs. They are cute but rarely deliver true laugh-out-loud moments. As we patiently wait in anticipation for the master of comedy, Adam McKay, to have his newest film, Anchorman 2, released in theaters, we find ourselves desperate for a fix of comedy. This is how we end up watching a film like Scary Movie V.The original Scary Movie was a much needed parody of Scream and all the pathetic slasher film rip-offs that followed. While there were some scenes where the film was trying too hard to be funny, the screenplay flawlessly blended together all the slasher flicks that followed Scream and had it's own original twist ending that took bits from all the best films of the 90's. It was the first good parody film since the 80's when Jim Abrahams and Jerry and David Zucker were working together on such classics as The Naked Gun and Airplane! The poster for Scary Movie had the tagline: No mercy. No shame. No sequel. Yet they didn't just make a shameful sequel, they made 3 of them. Even bringing in David Zucker to take over for Keenen Ivory Wayans as director for parts 3 and 4 didn't help. With every entry in the series, the films only got worse. Even as guilty pleasures to watch with friends for mindless entertainment, they stopped working as all the attempts at jokes were only pop-culture references that quickly became out-dated. We didn't think it could get worse than Scary Movie 4 but we were wrong, dead wrong.Scary Movie V or Scary MoVie takes both film parodies and film itself to an unprecedented new low. While it's safe to say this will be the worse movie of 2013, it is an understatement. It is worse than that. It's one of the worse films to have ever been made and makes Grown-Ups 2 seem Oscar-worthy.

Review title: Review the movie on the screen
Review_body: Most of the Scary Movie movies are Dumb, Whacky, fast-paced and slightly Lame - good fits to their genre, meeting everybody's expectations.This one's a little different. It's got a brain.The basics are all there with one exception: instead of throwing all the shtick at you in manic fast cuts (what ye laugh at sticks, wa ye nae, nae), Scary Movie V slows everything down. The individual scenes are still short and focused, still basically scatter-shot but very, very slowly paced compared to the genre norm.The opening skit, a Charlie Sheen parody staring Charlie Sheen, epitomizes the pacing and tone, throwing in such staples as outrageous misdirection (the DVDs and cameras), a Benny Hill fast-forward pseudo-sex bit and tons of double entendres. All elements stated in a sedate 2/2 pace steadfast to the end.Another difference - the movie's skits are intelligent. The constant references to other movies are on the mark, like the Snoop Dog bit with Cabin in the Woods being referenced as 'cabin in the woods (generic)' instead of Cabin in the Woods (the movie): Snoop and his buddy driving each other nuts running that loop. Another way of putting it, most of the skits are multi-layered rather than single dimensioned, quick jokes.In short, this not your run-of-the mill Scary Movie. Its humor is dry, its pacing is sedate and the theater isn't going to collapse from all the belly laughs. A good wine to be savored, not endless shots of cheap whiskey for a fast drunk.The only negative: the narration. Script is fine, voice-over is distracting. They should of stuck to UberScript.Giving it a ten because none of the shtick fails (except the narration), violating another genre convention - the point of fast-cut, fast-paced scatter-shot bits: hiding (or over shooting) the shtick that doesn't work.And, as I replay it for this review, stuff like the Vacuum Cleaner Pool Party and the Planet of the Apes bit gets better. Hell, all the shtick gets better second time around. Easy to see how anyone expecting the usual, run-of-the-mill Scary Movie would be disappointed and, perhaps, angry at this radical departure from the norm BUT ReviewTMOTScreen. Or just say, or scream, This Isn't A Scary Movie! and leave it at that instead of trashing the movie you haven't really been watching.P.S I'm not a laugh out loud kind of person - I've never laughed in a theater or at home - and, first time around, while I appreciated the nuanced bits, no belly laughs. Then, as I began finishing the above review (while second-viewing), felt little up-turns at the corners of my lips, followed by actual chuckles as I anticipated each of the 'Shave and a Haircut, Two Bits!' bits I remembered from first-time-around.Shocking! I finished and submitted the review and then had a third go at it. Smile and chuckles returned, triggered by particularly clever twists-on-expectations, played in all-in-innocence deadpan.I may be the only person who feels this way (fine, my prerogative) but SMV is a total gem.

Review title: Mama meets Paranormal Activity 2 meets Rise of Planet of the Apes meets Black Swan meets Inception meets Evil Dead - And has a Hell of a party!
Review_body: This is a review from a die-hard "Scary Movie" lover (who had to be initially dragged to see part 1 but became suddenly converted) so do not expect it to be neutral!The "Scary Movie" series is one of those franchises born at the turn of the century that inexplicably keeps on going and going ("Underworld" "Resident Evil" and "Fast & Furious" come to mind, all private family run cash cows for their stars and directors).Unloved from its inception with the original Wayans Brothers "Scary Movie" in 2000, these films carry on the glorious tradition of the bawdy sexy parody of popular serious works of the moment, something that has been going on as long as the seven arts themselves, and in cinema since its beginning. Now in its third film under the tutelage of the grand master (if one excludes Mel Brooks) of the genre David "Airplane" Zucker, and directed by another parody master Malcolm D. Lee, this fifth instalment as ever cross-sections the plots of various popular horror and Sci-Fi movies of the last few years. The main thread is based on the recent Gulliermo Del Toro produced "Mama" (Here all those disgruntled horror fans finally get the purely evil Edith Eames they all wanted along with a conventional corny "happy ending" version of the cliff-top finale rather than the tragi-poetic one they all hated) intermixed with the web-cam horror of "Paranormal Activity" (part 2 in particular). The couple at the centre of this conjoined domestic paranormal invasion are played by returning SM star Simon Rex, playing the Kostner-Waldau part while the Jessica Chastain role is taken by former child star Ashley Tisdale, who in a magnificently inspired moment is literally "stripped" of Chastain's infamous Punky Goth look, while the Elizabeth and Victoria child roles are taken by the very talented youngsters Gracie Witton and Ava Kolker, who match the adult stars gag for gag. They are joined by the very funny Lidia Porto, who is not afraid of making fun of herself as the superstitious Latin Maid from "PA2", and steals almost every scene she is in. Both also have sub-plots that bring in 2 other 2011 blockbusters (I suspect this film started life in 2011 and was then resumed with up to the second stuff) with Rex taking James Franco's role in "Rise of the Planet of the Apes" creating super intelligent ape Caesar (who also helps out with the ghostly goings on but only suffers repeated violence for his pains) in the lab. Tisdale on the other hand takes Natalie Portman's role in an extended spoof on Aronofksy' risible "Black Swan" (a film already so much a burlesque parody that it is an achievement in itself to be able to mock it so well here) that introduces us to Erica Ash as Kendra, - Mila Kunis role in the original – who becomes her sidekick and friend (as well as lover and rival as per BS) as well as J.P Manoux doing a delicious take on Vincent Cassel's director and Molly Shannon capturing only too well Winona Ryder's embittered alcoholic ex- prima ballerina. Also included are skits on "Inception" –gamely done considering that "Inception satirizing" has become a sort of mini-industry- that go into loving detail for key scenes and feature lookalikes Ben Cornish and Kate Walsh standing in for De Caprio and Cotillard and a side splitting riff on "The Evil Dead" (both remake and original) that sees the girls reading of the Necromicon induce horrific acts of self-mutilation amongst a group of Christian students trying to detox their own Mia from Energy Shots, only to be left in pieces when the spell is undone (they don't magically regenerate as in the Alvarez version!)Starting and ending (stay to the end of the credits for a final scene) with actual Scary Movie veteran Charlie Sheen and Lindsay Lohan playing up their recent lifestyle disasters in a "Paranormal Activity" skit that turns into a full blown acrobatic routine featuring look-alike performers and even circus clowns!The humour in the film is surprisingly rather old fashioned and "Vaudevillian". Gone are most of the gross out and "ghetto" gags from the earlier instalments (save a brilliant bit of screwball two-handing from rappers Snoop Dogg and Bow-Wow who play the hunters that find the girls in the cabin) to be replaced by the traditional "Zucker" weapons of machine-gun puns,verbal gags and visual/physical humour – people being hit on the head, kicked in the balls, falling off ladders, gags involving beds, stairs, catching fire, falling down, being by spooked by pop up books, etc. It returns to the style of "Airplane" and "The Naked Gun" and despite what critics are saying is actually both the best made Scary Movie (if that's also the funniest I don't know?) and the funniest Zucker parody of recent years. With the departure of original stars Anna Faris and Regina Hall in the 6 year interval since part 4, Tisdale and Ash have stepped into their roles and are clearly being set up as the future itineration of their "Dumb white chick-Sleazy Ghetto Black Chick" double act. They are quite different in how they play their roles (more understated, less showy) but both have great talent and if the series continues then hopefully we will be seeing them again soon.The film initially proved a misfire, but take has been steadily increasing, and besides its main life will be on DVD and download, where the money will be made. Roll on Scary Movie 6!

Review title: Embarrassingly bad, from the cast to the spoofs; the franchise reaches a new low
Review_body: The fifth installment of the popular horror spoof franchise, 'Scary MoVie' is shameful in its badness. With a spoof consisting of mainly 'Mama' and the 'lost footage' horrors, as well as many non-horror films (such as 'Black Swan' or 'Rise of the Planet of Apes'), it is outclassed in every way by 'A Haunted House'.The 'Scary Movie' franchise, while very fun, tends to lose a bit of strength in each next movie. This time around it is the absence of Anna Faris and Regina Hall, the only regulars since the first one, that brings it down a lot. Instead, the new cast is atrocious. Ashley Tisdale, of the 'High School Musical' (in)fame, is completely lacking in both the funny, acting or charisma departments; Erica Ash is even more atrocious, and tries too hard to be a substitute for Regina Hall but falls flat; Simon Rex, a returner from the third and fourth films, is likable but ends up far too silly to work. Lidia Porto is another particularly full of bad moments, while the kids are surprisingly better than the adult cast.And what is there to say about Charlie Sheen and Lindsay Lohan? Their cartoonishly goofy scene at the beginning almost had me giving up on watching.The jokes fall flat most of the times. Some of the ideas had potential, but were too badly handled to work. In particular, the 'Evil Dead' and 'Black Swan' spoofs and the scenes involving Snoop Dog (Lion?) could have been great; but the first two ended up too stupid to work, whereas the last one was just too dry/badly acted.The closest to a saving grace this movie has is the 'Inception' spoof, which might be the only moment I laughed at all, and the fact this is a relatively short film at only 86 minutes long. This was just embarrassingly bad.

This movie is the culmination of comedic era headed straight into the dumpster brought on by the Hollywood Cash Grab Machine. This franchise and its subsequent spin offs started strong with the first 2 Scary Movie films, Date Movie, & at the bottom Epic Movie; then everything really went down hill as more and more got pumped out like Meet the Spartans, Vampires Suck, Disaster Movie, Superhero Movie, & the rest to follow in the spoof category. It's a shame really because with proper innovative writing there should have been many better spoof movies to be made with so much content to pull from and make fun of.Now for this movie, it is simply meh. There's a couple of chuckles here and there but mostly you'd have to be 13 and this is the first comedy you've ever seen to enjoy this really. A shame really because it does have quite a few talented comedic actors in it but I think they went to a junior high and asked them to pen the script or the "adult" writers were far too baked at work.

Ashley Tisdale does her absolute best but even she can't save this film from mediocrity. In this fifth instalment, slapstick runs rather dry and many, many gags outstay their welcome. Hits like Inception, Black Swan and Mama are spoofed earning some healthy laughs but many dated cultural references and pop culture gags fall flat, this isn't as bad as the first two Scary Movie films but it's certainly one of the weakest, reaching to the bottom of the barrel in desperation. Scary MoVie sees young parents Dan and Jody raise their adopted nieces who have a twisted spirit overlooking them. Jody begins to experience paranormal activity in their new home, and soon realises an evil dead demon is stalking them, Jody must now venture to the cabin in the woods to find the book of the dead and stop the deadly curse, whilst Dan focuses on his job at the Ape research facility. The problem here is too many big films are being spoofed, from Inception, Black Swan, Mama, Evil Dead, Paranormal Activity, Insidious, The Cabin In The Woods, even Tyler Perry's Madea and Fifty Shades Of Grey. Writers David Zucker and Pat Proft cram it all in, the film is bursting at its seams with a lot of bad jokes and a feeling of desperation. The scenes where Simon Rex falls over whilst trying to set up the cameras drove me mental as it wasn't funny, the fight between Dan and Rosa, and the repetition of the Cabin in the woods joke fizzled out quicker than you can say boring. The dancing Mama and the Ape's talking about Matt Damon really killed hope, there's so much that falls flat, the Fifty Shades Of Grey scene was pointless and the Inception scene really felt forced. However, the whole Black Swan sequences work superbly, the Evil Dead book scene was hilarious and the opening with Charlie Sheen and Lindsay Lohan ripping their personal lives maybe lousy but it works. Erica Ash is superb as Kendra, J.P. Manoux is very funny as Pierre the ballet teacher, and Molly Shannon reels out some big laughs as a broken, alcoholic smoking professional dancer, there are some great jokes here, Ashley Tisdale is great at slapstick and she echoes an Anna Faris in the making, although Faris cannot be beat when it comes to these films. The found footage aspects are decent, especially when exploring their new home, seeing Jody smack the baby into the door frame, setting its head on fire then blasting fire extinguishers reign madness, it's unapologetically poor humour but I chuckled. Running in at under feature length, Scary Movie 5 feels long and exhausting, it tries to be something big but it really is just a squashed mixed bag labelled as a movie, and Director Malcolm D. Lee does nothing to polish or let alone add craft to this tiresome spoof.

Review title: 85 Minutes of My Life I'll Never Get Back!
Review_body: "Scary Movie 5" has two good things going for it. First...it's 85 minutes long. Any bit longer and you may find yourself looking for anything sharp to carve out your eyes with. And second, the film "Jeepers Creepers" exists so it will just barely avoid the title of worst movie ever made...at least in this reviewer's humble opinion. The earlier films in this series, while not award winning, could at least generate a few good laughs...but my lord, this is just an awful film no matter how you cut the mustard. Dragged out potty humor jokes that rely on something a first grader MIGHT slightly chuckle at, a parade of has- been B-listers who try to make fun of themselves but clearly appear to the viewer that they are in the movie only to pay off their taxes and lawyer fees, and sight-gags that quite frankly....just fail. A keg party of robot pool cleaners??? A very large woman in a thong bikini??? Food made of human waste?? An ape on the toilet??? These are the "high point" funny moments. If this kind of stuff is what you enjoy, fear not, I'm sure you'll find this one in the $5.00 bin at Wal*Mart in the very near future. But until then, dust off some of the earlier movies from this series, as well as "Airplane", "Naked Gun", "Hot Shots", or others from that earlier genre, and save your admission money for something a little less.......stupid?

Review title: It's alright but what did you expect, class?
Review_body: Charlie Sheen is himself and very funny in the opening scenes with Lindsay Lohan sending each other up perfectly. Forget plot, it's a Scary Movie film, just like Hot Shots, Not Another Teen Movie, Epic Movie, Superhero Movie and so on.... just a reason for a series of good and not so good parodies of pop culture films. And, in this case the book 50 Shades of Grey gets a look in with the unlikely pairing of Jerry O'Connell & Mike Tyson appearing opposite Ashley Tisdale in that sequence. My highlights were the Black Swan & ongoing Paranormal Activity rip offs, especially the pool cleaner party. Look at it this way, it's mindless fun, better with a beer in hand. It has it's moments and for those who care, stay on AFTER THE CREDITS for an extra scene. Ashley Tisdale is brilliant at the dead pan comedy required although I did miss Anna Faris a little.

Review title: It's not worth your time so don't even bother
Review_body:
It's the early 2000s parody formula but "butchered" in 2013. This movie came out so late here in Norway! Jesus!Anyway, Scary Movie V is the latest installment in the Scary Movie franchise. In this one, most of the cast from the previous movies are absent. That's not a good sign. In this one, we get parodies of more recent movies, like Paranormal Activity, Mama, Rise of the Planet of the Apes and ... The Shawshank Redemption? Oh well, only two of those are horror movies, but oh well...I'm gonna cut right to the chase. This movie is not horrible. If you thought the previous ones were funny, you're gonna think this one is funny. In fact, I find Scary Movie V to be one of the funnier movies in the series. That may be because I've seen most of the movies parodied in this one, as opposed to the other ones where there's only a couple parodies per movie I actually get.Anyways, back to the point: Everyone seems to hate this movie, and I say: What do you except? Do you really want a clever comedy with smart humor and jokes that you are gonna remember your whole life? No. The Scary Movies are stupid. Some of the stupidest movies ever, but that doesn't matter, because they know it. They don't try to make it good, they're just making another Scary Movie.I think a lot of people have forgotten to have mindless fun with comedies. Everyone expects a comedy to be memorable these days. Yes, this movie's not the most fun you'll have in the theater, but it is a fun movie to watch with friends none-the-less.Again, if you like the other Scary Movies, there's no reason not to watch this one: It's pretty much a modern take on the same formula that's been going on for 13 years now. It's good for what it is.

Review title: I almost regret not walking out of the theater.
Review_body: The era of spoof and parody is dead.Let me start off by saying that I knew this film was going to be horrible from the start. I had read reviews and knew it was bad, but being so infatuated with film and theater, I actually wanted to see the movie to diagnose exactly what made it so horrible. (Insult me if you must, but I have a lot of free time on my hands and I love all kinds of movies.)I'm not gonna lie, I went into the theater with the hope that on some slight chance, I would enjoy the film. Wrong. The movie was so boring and tasteless that I was actually distracted with my phone for some parts during the film, which is of the utmost rarity for me. The horrible acting and line delivery dried this film out so much that I don't know where to begin. Ashley Tisdale was definitely not as good as Anna Faris was, and obviously, everyone will compare the two. I hate to admit it, but Mac Miller, Snoop Dogg, and Katt Williams all could have made audiences laugh with the material they were given, but were just too dry. Admittedly, there were some very rare parts of the movie that had a somewhat witty humor to it, but it was only once or twice, and weak at that. The rest of the stupid slapstick humor was just so lame and dragging. Slapstick humor should stay within the PG level of humor for the kids. On that note, the movie had overly crude, and just STUPID sexual humor that was just stupid and weak. Even hard R teenage sex comedies are more sophisticated than this. I laughed maybe one time, and it wasn't even a laugh. I kinda exhaled sharply while smiling. Overall, there was almost no sophisticated or witty humor, horrid acting, and it was all just plain bad. So yes, the reviews are correct, it was horrible. The only reason I give it a 3 instead of a 1 was because hundreds and hundreds of people put months and months of work into an 85 minute piece of what they thought was art, and giving a movie a 1 or maybe a 2 is too disrespectful to the art that is film. (But then again, this movie is pretty disrespectful to the art that is film as well.)

Fans liked 'Scary Movie and 'Scary Movie 2' when they came out in 2000 and 2001. After that the director was changed and in 2003 'Scary Movie 3' came out, which fans didn't like, even though it had a higher budget and bigger cast. The budget was even higher for 'Scary Movie 4', which came out 2006, which fans hated. 'Scary Movie 5' was meant to come out in October or 2008, but that never happened. Now, from the same writers of 'Scary Movie 3' and 'Scary Movie 4', comes 'Scary Movie 5', the real release date. It's not called 'Scary MoVie'. I don't know why it's called that on IMDb. Anyway, since it had a failed release date, didn't have a real one until five years after the failed one, and was from the same writers of two movies that did poorly with fans and critics, the expectations were very low for this movie... But it still had a negative 4% Rotten Tomatoes critic score, and a 57% user score, which was also negative, but almost positive. I really didn't think this movie that horrible.This movie was stupid... It was very very stupid. There were many, many jokes in this movie, which was a bad thing. The jokes were almost all from the same humor. It was very strange humor. The humor was funny, but not hilarious. The humor also got old very quick. Since it went on so long, and didn't really change, it had a clear path to get old quickly, and it did. The jokes were also all over the place, and sometimes they would drag on too long and not be funny anymore. Sometimes there would be many things happen in a row that were too similar to be funny, even the second time. I don't dislike stupid humor, but there's a right way to do stupid humor, and they didn't pull it off very well.Getting past that the humor was stupid and the same and all of the other faults I found in it, 'Scary Movie 5' was a funny movie. At the beginning, when the humor wasn't old yet, and some other parts in the movie, I laughed most of the time. The jokes still lingered for a while in some of the funny parts, but the beginnings of the jokes would be enjoyable. Even though the humor stayed the same in the movie, They changed what they were making fun of several times. Some of the times it matched the movies they made fun of, and sometimes it didn't. When the humor and jokes hit the movie spoofs they matched, 'Scary Movie 5' would be funny and enjoyable then. They could never pull off a very long portion of the enjoyable parts, though. The first Scary Movie was decent. It didn't deserve a sequel let alone 4! Scary Movie 3 was alright, mainly because they had replaced the foul juvenile Wayans brothers with the writer of Airplane! and The Naked Gun. Getting rid of the scatological crude humor and bringing in the cleverer intelligent laughs worked. But Scary MoVie is just as bad possibly even worse than the sickening antics of Scary Movie 2.Usually in a review I would do a summary of the plot. But the writers of Scary MoVie haven't got time for plots! Ashley Tisdale and Simon Rex adopt some weird kids, movie into a new house and vulgar toilet jokes ensue. The weird kids are obviously meant to be like the weird kids from Mama. (SPOOF NUMBER ONE). And Simon Rex works at an ape training lab, which is meant to be like Rise of the Planet of the Apes. (SPOOF NUMBER TWO). His girlfriend Ashley Tisdale is a ballet dancer who is trying to keep the lead role of The Dying Swan which is meant to be like Black Swan. (SPOOF NUMBER THREE).When their asleep loads of jump scares and loud noises are happening, all while being filmed with surveillance cameras. That's meant to be like the Paranormal Activity franchise. (SPOOF NUMBER FOUR). At the beginning of the movie Snoop Dog and some other guy (who looks like Macklemore but isn't Macklemore) are going through a forest and find an old cabin in the woods, that's meant to be like you guessed it The Cabin In The Woods. (SPOOF NUMBER FIVE). Later on Ashley Tisdale goes to the cabin in the woods and a bunch of teenagers are there. There all praising religion and singing cheerful songs, which is the exact opposite of what they do in The Evil Dead. (SPOOF NUMBER SIX). A Morgan Freeman soundalike is narrating the movie, which is meant to be like all those movies which Morgan Freeman has narrated. (SPOOF NUMBER SEVEN). When Ashley Tisdale starts having messed up dreams she gets a dream specialist to help her out. The dream specialist looks exactly like Leonardo Di Caprio from Inception, they even have the bit where he's explaining everything at a cafe. (SPOOF NUMBER EIGHT). And finally for one reason or another Ashley Tisdale ends up in a bedroom about to bang with Christian Grey. That's meant to be like the book 50 Shades of Grey. (SPOOF NUMBER NINE).So there are 9 different spoofs in an 86 minute movie. That's something like 1 spoof every 8 minutes. When a movie copies a scene or a concept from another movie but adds in some sh*t jokes, it doesn't make a parody it makes a sh*tty mess!To makes matters worse all of the characters in the movie are annoying and deserve to die. I was trying to think of someone who was likable and appeared in Scary MoVie. But they don't exist! Simon Rex's character wasn't too bad at the start, but he got so stupid it was unbearable. This is just another 21st century spoof movie - not funny at all! There hasn't been an above average spoof movie since 1994 when the third Naked Gun movie came out. It seems to be no longer possible!Overall I give Scary MoVie 4/10 for 7 laughs throughout the whole 86 minute movie, mainly because of the mildly amusing narrator.

Review title: Scary Movie 5 follows in the footsteps of its predecessors
Review_body: Scary Movie 5 is a parody movie comprised of slapstick humor, whimsical characters, and celebrity satire. The movie is done in the same vain as all the other Scary Movies. I think that Scary Movie 5 is one of the better movies in the series, Scary Movie 3 being my favorite one. The movie is over-the-top and there is hardly anything witty about the humor or writing. Some of the scenes are ridiculous enough to come out of a child's imagination. Or maybe a child's imagination would have resulted in better quality humor than what was presented in this movie. Nevertheless, I really enjoyed this movie, even though I know that the jokes are childish, over-the-top, and exaggerated. I have always enjoyed movies within this genre, movies such as the Scary Movies and The Comebacks. Meanwhile, I am not one to enjoy other exaggerated movies, like Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy. I am not sure why such movies appeal to me more than others. If I had to come up with a reason why I liked the Scary Movies is parody: I like the satirical and ironic imitations that are intrinsic of parody. The difference between this movie and the others is, for a lack of better word, subtlety. In previous movies, especially the first two movies, there are a lot of jokes related to disgusting events or disfigured and disturbing people. The first movie had an explicit over- the-top sex scene. The fifth installment's sex scene used more figurative imagery to represent what went on. A disfigured man in the second movie was the basis of a lot of jokes. Here, the only thing that comes close to that is a genetically-enhanced ape that is parodying The Rise of the Planet of the Apes.I like Scary Movie 5 because of its parodies of movies, its slapstick humor, its whimsical characters, and celebrity satire. I am overlooking stupidity and the exaggeration because it does not bother me at all: I expect it as part of the movie.

The Paranormal Activity spoof was nice and it being connected to MAMA was great, but how it delivers its comedy was blech... And WHY THE HEL DID THEY INCLUDE RISE OF THE PLANET OF THE APES?! I mean, it's a good movie, but it's not good enough to be a SCARY MOVIE. Adding the Evil Dead into the movie was funny but it's too short, while Black Swan was heavily parodied, including the Lesbian Scenes, Uh, we don't need those, okay? And the climax of the movie, BOY IT REALLY SUCKS, they could've done better, but MAMA FALLING INTO A SHARK INFESTED JACUZZI? SUUUUUCKS. Moving on to the Characters, Ashley Tisdale was good at her part but not enough to make it totally funny, and Also Simon Rex. To sum it all up, Scary MoVie is a comedy that'll only make you wanna watch it if you're a fan of the series. Comedy is 3/10 Storyline is 1/10

Cinema is really taking a nosedive this year. The definition of the word joke is really changing before my eyes. Please let there be someone out there with a defibrillator and bring the parody movie back to life. I was surprised that Mac Miller would make me laugh because I can't get into his music. The other laugh I got was when the husband and the maid fought on the front yard.Are you seriously going to parody "Fifty Shades of Grey" when that is not even a movie yet? This movie was already late to the party when they parody "Inception", "Black Swan", "Rise of the Planet of the Apes" and "Madea" You also put Ted in the poster? He is not even in the movie! If he was, it wouldn't even had been clever. It would have been a cheap CGI version of him or a little guy in a god awful Ted costume. I bet that they filmed the parody of "Evil Dead" right before they released it. There was another joke about the pool machine cleaners having a party. That really feel flat. I bet Ashley Tisdale did this because she had no other offers on the table. Ignore this movie.

Its hard to believe how this film was even made and whats more shocking is that the actors actually thought it would be a good idea to be in it.I will point out that i am not a huge fan of horror films so i may not have a great knowledge on some of the movies being parodied. I shouldn't and wouldn't expect a movie like this to be 10/10 as it is just a silly parody movie and i have seen the others in the series. The writing was okay in the previous ones and there were definitely laughs throughout but this one the writing is awful and the movie relies heavily on slapstick humour. I half giggled once i think in the whole movie.I wouldn't bother wasting your time to see this, i even think 'A haunted house' is better than this and that is saying something. I can see why Anna Farris wasn't in it.1/10 I hope this is the last one.

Review title: I used to like parody films, but this...
Review_body: I have seen all Scary Movies, Disaster Movie, Superhero Movie, Epic Movie etc, and almost every time I was enjoying it, because of some funny scenes. If you like this type of movies - even if not, sometimes -, you can laugh out loud and have a good time either alone either with party. I am not saying that those films are the best way to spend your time with friends, but it could be a good - just good - choice. Definitely better than watching a horror movie like Scream, Paranormal Activity etc, in my opinion.However, in the case of Scary Movie 5, things are, unfortunately, different. What I am trying to say, is that this movie is not even amusing. Scary Movie 5 is really boring. The first time I tried to see the movie, I stopped watching at 30 minutes. The second time I was determined and, honestly, I tried to see the whole movie from the beginning, but it was hard. I asked myself: "Why are you doing this to yourself? What's the purpose?", and I stopped watching again.If you are in a good mood, and you want to see something that will help you, prefer Airplane, Naked Gun, Life of Brian or some other parodies. Maybe those movies not extremely funny, but I think they're better from the 5th Scary Movie. I don't recommend it, it's unworthy.

Review title: This was the worst movie I have ever seen in my life.
Review_body: First of all, I usually love spoof movies that are goofy that everyone else hates. This one is different. Ana Farris was terribly missed. Regina Hall was also noticeably missed. This movie didn't have a single laugh. It was just a spoof of Mama, which I don't even know how they got it made so fast considering Mama just came off the movies. It also spoofed Evil Dead which just started this same weekend. No matter how much you think you might like this movie, or how much you think you would like it anyway, I warn you. You WILL wish you hadn't gone. I guarantee this movie will not be showing in two weeks. It had to be a fairly decent budget because the production values were pretty decent, but I just don't see how this movie ever got approved to be made. The casting was horrible. They should have just waited for Ana Farris to be available. This movie is not even worth renting at Redbox or even watching on cable for free.

Review title: Basically, an exploitation film for weed- and gangsta rap-obsessed 13-year-olds
Review_body: I really don't know where to even start with this, so let's just get started. This movie is not funny. There you go - it fails as a comedy. In addition to that, it's dumb, mean-spirited, and in poor taste, and I think you're going to agree with me about that even if you like stuff that is in poor taste. I mean, this is basically an exploitation film for weed- and gangsta rap-obsessed 13-year-olds. It covers all the bases: sex scene involving clowns and ponies, sex scene involving pool cleaning machines, dildo collections being found by small children, things getting stuck up dogs' anuses, a scene featuring Snoop Dogg (or Snoop Lion or whatever he insists that people call him now) and a giant blunt, etc. Wow, this is multiplex entertainment in 2013?I saw the first Scary Movie and thought it was pretty amusing in places. I'm also a huge fan of totally absurd slapstick comedies like Airplane and the Naked Gun movies. What is it exactly that makes this film so awful where the others, at least on some level, succeeded? I can't think of any way to explain it except this: watching Scary MoVie is the film equivalent of eating White Castle sliders for an hour and a half, washing them down with a gallon of Mountain Dew, topping it all off with seven pounds of cheesecake and then doing the Mentos and Coke thing (featured in this film, incidentally) so you can projectile-puke the stuff you just ate all over your friends who were expecting it and think it's funny. Truly, honestly, that's the caliber of stuff you're going to subject yourself to for 90 minutes if you insist on watching this.The movie tries to make fun of Inception, Black Sawn, Evil Dead, etc., but it seems to me that you have to actually be smarter than something if you want to effectively make fun of it. Instead, they should make a movie that makes fun of all the Scary Movie movies. Honestly, they should be pretty easy targets. This movie does not have the minimum level of intelligence required to comment about anything at all. The best it can do is make "peehole" jokes and try to get the audience to laugh at monkeys flinging poo at the wall. No, it's really not funny.I'm racking my brains trying to recall if there was anything at all good about this film. I do remember laughing at a couple of the gags. That sex scene with clowns and ponies was actually somewhat amusing - there, I said it. I'm afraid this review is going to come off the wrong way because it sounds like I refuse to watch stuff that pushes boundaries of good taste. Hardly, man. I even liked Videodrome, which Roger Ebert called "nauseating." The real problem is that this film uses boundary-pushing as an excuse to be stupid. In reality, it's about as intelligent as a stoned middle school dropout, incidentally the only type of person I can imagine enjoying this.I was about to start getting depressed about the state of the world given that this kind of obvious dog dookie is considered entertainment, but it doesn't seem that other people found it all that entertaining either. I watched at least two couples walk out of the theater before the end of the film, so ultimately I'm concluding that there's probably some reason to have hope about the future of this planet. Thanks, Scary MoVie! Not that there's anything to be thankful for except that no one actually came up to me and hit me in the head with a shovel while the film was playing. They'll probably include that in part six.

One cannot really expect much from Scary Movie 5, the weakest and most tedious of the so called "comedy" franchise so far. Starring Ashley Tisdale and Charlie Sheen (who is only present within the first painful five minutes in a non funny sketch with Lindsay Lohan) the film spoofs big hitters such as Mama, Evil Dead and mostly Paranormal Activity, as well as non horror films Inception and Rise of the Planet of the Apes, which believe you me, comes across as an even more boring watch than the actual horror spoofs. The film drags from one loose plot line to the next, and literally rams down unfunny toilet humor gags down our throats in the hope that we find them the least bit humorous or clever. Scary Movie 5 possess no humor whatsoever, and let's be honest, does it really come as a shock? The not so painful truth is behind this movie is, every gag resolves into a heavy sigh and the rolling of eyes. The thing is with Scary Movie 5 is that it is rated as 15 like its predecessors, but the truth of it all is that the film really is aimed at anyone under the age of 5. The funniest part about Scary Movie 5 is that the target audience is not even old enough to watch it, and by the time they are, the film will be forgotten. I wouldn't even give it that long. My Verdict: A mindless bore that really doesn't improve on any of its previous instalments, and makes you sincerely wish that the Scary Movie franchise will just go away forever.

The only time I remember laughing was Molly Shannon' s cameo. The biggest problem with this movie (Aside from the fact that it exists.) Is a problem that Selter/Friedberg movies have...they're out of date by the time they hit the theater.Final Verdict: Skip it!

Review title: The worst one of the entire series
Review_body: The only intelligent actor/actress from the entire Scary Movie series is Anna Ferris. You know why I say that, is because she wasn't in Scary Movie 5. She was smart. I'm not sure exactly what went wrong with this one, but I enjoyed the last 4 a lot more. Given that the 4th one was reaching a new level of stupidity, it was still 10x more funnier than the 5th. I regret paying $10 to watch this. This is the 2nd time in two weeks that I have made the mistake to pay money to see a stupid movie that ended up making me completely question why I go to the movies. Hollywood needs to wake up. Just because you can charge people money to see a movie, doesn't mean you should. Certain movies do not belong at the movie theater, and this one should have been on that list. The director should have never let this movie leave their studio, and for the sake of all of the actors, someone there should have stopped this movie from being produced. Again - I enjoyed the first 4, but I am now done with the Scary Movie saga. Enough is enough, this is just insulting. You can easily tell that even the highest paid actors like Charlie Sheen and that chick from Modern Family, put on a massive layer of suck in their roles. Are we all getting that lazy now days that we are going to record ourselves doing a horrible job, posting it to the world, and expecting money to come rolling in? I think the writers of Scary Movie should delete this one, and make a new Scary Movie 5. The next one that comes out will only be watched on DVD.

With a whole new cast being brought in ,comes new and abrupt audience reactions .Even Charlie Sheen in the introduction did not really stand out in the movie that much as he is being thrown around in the room with ridiculous clichés .The scary factor is mediocre as this production really shows that it does not understand the trilogy of the balancing of scare factor and humor frequencies in the franchise .Scary Movie 2 had a similar parody box ;The Haunting 1999 and The Exorcist.Even if The Haunting 1999 had very large scare criticisms according to critiques ,Scary Movie 2 still could carry the parody atmosphere with characters like The Caretaker .However ,Scary Movie 5 had a very large parody box thrown on the table for them ;Paranormal Activity ,TheCabinintheWoods and Sinister .These movies boomed above average with their setup and horror avalanche ,but this movie could not seem to understand that .Halfway through ,the ridiculous attempts to make the audience laugh non-stop was just utter rubbish for a horror parody movie.The past 4 movies executed humor with great timing along with its scary factor .The only movie this movie parodied well in their parody box is MAMA .That I am actually impressed .The connection with the other parodied movies collapsed but the sequence and humor was above average ,but still it did not carry the theme of family like in MAMA.The movie tried so hard trying to show the so-called 'family connection' between Jodi as the stepmom and Kathy and Lily and Aidan as the children .The movie didn't even try to show the sense of family relationship and love as we do not see Jodi or Dan even feeding them or showing any signs of family love after Maria was fired .Even with Maria there ,the movie did not give these three a chance to show affectionate love towards the children .All they did was to make Jodi asking herself whether she was getting in touch with them(the children) and expose her to ridiculous humor .Overall,the movie was very close to performing a mediocre showcase.

Review title: The Weakest of the series, but still Hilarious
Review_body: Forst off, yes, it is stupid and ridiculous, but it is supposed to be. Whoever doesn't get that should never watch it, but don't trash talk a movie just because it does not appeal to your taste. It does feel choppy, but so did the other 4, which all have random scenes that don't have anything to do with the plot (such as the "wazzup" scene in the first or the basketball scene in the second). Overall, most of the spoofs were done well, even though the younger crowd won't get a lot of the ones from more "grown up" material such as 50 shades, Inception and Black Swan, which are dated and would have been funnier two years ago when those movies were still fresh. Despite what's wrong, I rated it a 10 because it did exactly what I wanted it to do, make me laugh. It is a great addition to the series, and the new cast does their best, although they are weak in comparison to the original stars of the series. The biggest mistake was having Simon Rex play a different character. He could have definitely been George again, because it's not like we aren't used to characters dying and coming back. The filmmakers probably watched A Haunted House and realized that they had to do re-shoots, which was a great decision. There are similar jokes, but they are definitely different in terms of humor and content. As usual, this film has had quite a large lack of promotion, just like Scream 4 and Spy Kids 4, which i'm sure has led to it's sad box office results. Movies like Date Movie, Epic Movie and Meet the Spartans were all huge hits and proved that the opinions of critics do not matter, and once people actually watch the movie instead of bad mouthing it, they'll realize that it is hilarious for what it is. I hope that there is an alternate cut on DVD. I would love to see how it was before the re-shoots, which were obviously done to make it stand out from a Haunted House, an under-rated spoof which in my eyes is the real Scary Movie 5. the actual SM5 is a good try and I would love to see another, even though this will probably be the last.

Review title: Another hilarious movie from the Scary Movie team.
Review_body: Judging from the 3.7 stars grade here on IMDb, people didn't like this movie too much. This surprised me, since my guess would be that most users, especially those that go on the page of this movie, are probably under 30. I guess these people just don't understand or get the humor.3.7 is way too low for this movie.The fifth installment of the Scary Movie series starts of with Charlie Sheen and Lindsay Lohan in bed, spoofing Paranormal Activity. After that, Scary MoVie, just like the previous movies, spoofs other movies. Movies that get spoofed are Mama, Paranormal Activity, The Cabin in the Woods, Black Swan and The Rise of the Apes.After the first scene, we get to follow Mac Miller and Snoop Dogg walking through a forest, looking for a place that grows "the best marijuana". They are gonna go there, and leave. They are later seen running with a huge joint, that both are carrying. They then find a cabin, and a slightly tiresome dialog breaks out between Mac and Snoop, in which Snoop doesn't know what movie Mac is talking about when they are looking at a "Cabin in the Woods". They enter the house, and they find two girls, like in Mama where two little kids are found in a cabin in the woods.Simon Rex and Ashley Tisdale portrays the parent characters of the horror movie Mama in Scary Movie 5. I personally am not a huge fan of Simon Rex's in this movie, as I think his humor and acting is a little bit too immature or whatever.There are also a lot of guest stars in this movie, for example Lindsay Lohan as mentioned before, along with Snoop Dogg, Mac Miller, Usher, Katt Williams, Madea, Lil Duval, Sarah Hyland, Bow Wow and more. They make the movie a lot better, as it gives the movie variation and other positive things.I can't remember the last time I laughed as much as I did during the scene where Sarah Hyland and Bow Wow along with two other actors, gets possessed (or something like that) while they are portraying the characters of the movie "The Cabin in the Woods", obviously in a cabin in the woods. When it all comes down, I think Scary MoVie was one of the best ones so far in the series. If you've enjoyed the previous Scary Movie titles, you will most likely love this one. It gets kind of slow at times, and I personally didn't like the gorilla scenes too much. All the funny scenes made up for that though. There is no 6.5 star grade, but that's what I give it.Thank you for reading!

It vaguely describes the things that are happening in Mama and all the other spoofs (like the Black Swan side plot) don't feel like they are embedded into the main storyline at all.Of course the plot lines weren't the main focus of all scary movies, but this one doesn't even try. Suddenly, there's Katt Williams appearing to attempt some sort of exorcism and disappears after 3 awkward minutes, leaving nobody laughing and everyone asking what the hell that was about. At another point, the pool-cleaning robots are having a pool party. Which is a totally unfunny idea in the first place, but they just went along with it and stretch that "joke" to over 2 minutes, making you look at your watch or cellphone or anything else, really.The only thing that saves the movie are some really good jokes here and there. But they are very rare and really not worth to sit through this ordeal. The only thing that could have made this worse is a dancing scene (Yes, Disaster Movie and Meet The Spartans, I'm looking at you) or a Michael Jackson joke...and how useless was that 50 Shades Of Grey spoof? At least they cut ca. 80% of it out of the final movie, which becomes obvious when they show so many parts of it during the credits.

All the Scary Movies are the same. There's not much more you can do with them. If you didn't like the first one, you will not like any of them. Are they stupid? Yes!!! But they are meant to be!!! If you are looking for award winners, you shouldn't be watching this kind of movie anyway. These are meant for people with a sense of humor......and even a weird sense of humor sometimes. So all the one star submitters probably shouldn't have even tried watching this type of movie to start with. Bad acting....bad special effects. ...weird....politically incorrect scenes. ...is all part of it. So yes....I enjoyed it. It had all the things you would usually expect with a "Scary Movie"

I had high hopes for this movie, i highly enjoyed 1 & 2, and 3 has its funny moments, with 4 being worth a watch (if only to say you have seen it) This film is without a doubt the worst film i have ever seen in cinema history, it has nothing of the humour in the first couple of films that was expertly provided by the Wayan Brothers, and the main (wo)man herself Anna Faris, who's expert timing and well placed gags literally made the Scary Movie franchise what is was, This film has none of their talents (which is extremely obvious) and has obviously been purchased by some obscure nobody who hoped to capitalise on the successful franchise.... Which FAILED in epic proportions, throughout the entire movie, i laughed a grand total of twice... and not the roll around belly ache laugh, just a minor chuckle... twice. In my opinion this film should be eradicated from history and be re-written ONLY if the Wayan Brothers are on board and ONLY if Anna Faris reprises her role as the hilarious Cindy Cambell.
